commitMessageTemplateSection.heading:
**Functional Purpose**: Section header for commit message template settings
**UI Location**: Settings → GitHub Syncer → Connected Section → Commit message template section (header)
**When Users See This**: When viewing the GitHub Syncer settings
**Technical Context**: Standard text
**Current English**: "Commit message template"
commitMessageTemplateSection.intro:
**Functional Purpose**: Explains the purpose of the commit message template setting
**UI Location**: Settings → GitHub Syncer → Connected Section → Commit message template section (paragraph below header)
**When Users See This**: When viewing the GitHub Syncer settings
**Technical Context**: Standard text
**Current English**: "Use this option to determine what your commit and PR messages should look like."
commitMessageTemplateSection.placeholder:
**Functional Purpose**: Introduces the list of available placeholder values for the commit message template
**UI Location**: Settings → GitHub Syncer → Connected Section → Commit message template section (paragraph above placeholder list)
**When Users See This**: When viewing the GitHub Syncer settings and considering custom commit messages
**Technical Context**: Standard text
**Current English**: "You can use the following placeholder values, which will be interpolated for each commit:"

**Functional Purpose**: Description for the `$track_slug` placeholder
**UI Location**: Settings → GitHub Syncer → Connected Section → Commit message template section (list item)
**When Users See This**: When reviewing available placeholders for commit messages
**Technical Context**: Placeholder `$track_slug` must remain unchanged
**Current English**: "The slug of the track (e.g. "csharp")."

**Functional Purpose**: Description for the `$track_title` placeholder
**UI Location**: Settings → GitHub Syncer → Connected Section → Commit message template section (list item)
**When Users See This**: When reviewing available placeholders for commit messages
**Technical Context**: Placeholder `$track_title` must remain unchanged
**Current English**: "The name of the track (e.g. "C#")"

**Functional Purpose**: Description for the `$exercise_slug` placeholder
**UI Location**: Settings → GitHub Syncer → Connected Section → Commit message template section (list item)
**When Users See This**: When reviewing available placeholders for commit messages
**Technical Context**: Placeholder `$exercise_slug` must remain unchanged
**Current English**: "The slug of the exercise (e.g. "hello-world")"

**Functional Purpose**: Description for the `$exercise_title` placeholder
**UI Location**: Settings → GitHub Syncer → Connected Section → Commit message template section (list item)
**When Users See This**: When reviewing available placeholders for commit messages
**Technical Context**: Placeholder `$exercise_title` must remain unchanged
**Current English**: "The name of the exercise (e.g. "Hello World")"

**Functional Purpose**: Description for the `$iteration_idx` placeholder
**UI Location**: Settings → GitHub Syncer → Connected Section → Commit message template section (list item)
**When Users See This**: When reviewing available placeholders for commit messages
**Technical Context**: Placeholder `$iteration_idx` must remain unchanged
**Current English**: "The iteration index of the exercise (e.g. "1")"

**Functional Purpose**: Description for the `$sync_object` placeholder
**UI Location**: Settings → GitHub Syncer → Connected Section → Commit message template section (list item)
**When Users See This**: When reviewing available placeholders for commit messages
**Technical Context**: Placeholder `$sync_object` must remain unchanged
**Current English**: "One of "Iteration", "Solution", "Track", or "Everything" depending on what is syncing. For automatic syncs, this will be "Iteration"."
commitMessageTemplateSection.note.note:
**Functional Purpose**: Label for a special note regarding commit message formatting
**UI Location**: Settings → GitHub Syncer → Connected Section → Commit message template section (strong tag within a paragraph)
**When Users See This**: When reviewing the commit message template settings
**Technical Context**: This is the bolded
Note:
prefix for a warning message
**Current English**: "Note:"
commitMessageTemplateSection.note.text:
**Functional Purpose**: Explains how leading/trailing/consecutive slashes and dashes in commit messages are handled
**UI Location**: Settings → GitHub Syncer → Connected Section → Commit message template section (paragraph below input field)
**When Users See This**: When reviewing the commit message template settings
**Technical Context**: Standard text
**Current English**: "If your commit message contains leading or trailing slashes or dashes, these will be stripped. If it contains multiple consecutive slashes or dashes, these will be reduced to single slashes or dashes."
commitMessageTemplateSection.save_button:
**Functional Purpose**: Button to save changes made to the commit message template
**UI Location**: Settings → GitHub Syncer → Connected Section → Commit message template section (action button)
**When Users See This**: After a user modifies the commit message template
**Technical Context**: Standard button text
**Current English**: "Save changes"
commitMessageTemplateSection.revert_butt:
**Functional Purpose**: Button to revert the commit message template to its default value
**UI Location**: Settings → GitHub Syncer → Connected Section → Commit message template section (action button)
**When Users See This**: When a user has modified the template from its default and wishes to undo changes
**Technical Context**: Standard button text
**Current English**: "Revert to default"
commitMessageTemplateSection.confirm_mod:
**Functional Purpose**: Title for the confirmation modal when reverting the commit message template
**UI Location**: Confirmation modal for reverting commit message template
**When Users See This**: When a user clicks "Revert to default"
**Technical Context**: Standard modal title
**Current English**: "Are you sure you want to revert your commit message template to default?"

**Functional Purpose**: Label for the confirmation button in the revert commit message template modal
**UI Location**: Confirmation modal for reverting commit message template (confirm button)
**When Users See This**: When a user is presented with the option to confirm or cancel reverting the template
**Technical Context**: Standard button label
**Current English**: "Revert"

**Functional Purpose**: Label for the cancellation button in the revert commit message template modal
**UI Location**: Confirmation modal for reverting commit message template (cancel button)
**When Users See This**: When a user is presented with the option to confirm or cancel reverting the template
**Technical Context**: Standard button label
**Current English**: "Cancel"
